problem_text:
19.93. Conjecture: There exists a function f : N × N →N such that, if G is a finite p-group with d generators and G has no epimorphic images isomorphic to the wreath product Cp ≀Cp, then each factor of the p-lower central series of G has order bounded above by f(p, d).
It is interesting to compare this conjecture with the celebrated characterization of Aner Shalev of finitely generated p-adic analytic pro-p-groups.
P. Spiga
